column2: An essential for any good honeymoon
Learning the traditional craft to making tasty Soba – big buckwheat noodles
If you're feeling unbelievably generous, help us get there!
Help us stop over somewhere nice for the night
Something to treasure forever from Japan
Learn about (and drink!) the sacred wine of Japan
A way to get around Japanese cities in style
De-stress, stretch and breathe in the Japanese countryside
Explore Tokyo, Akita, Kyoto, Osaka or another place on foot with a walking tour
Another essential – zoom between cities while taking in the scenery
Pay a visit to a traditional Japanese karaoke room and belt out some tunes
Take a look around one of Japan's most famous museums
Visit a former castle town and Samurai stronghold on the north island
Competitively consume as many bowls of Soba Noodles as possible – you get a certificate when you reach 100+.
The ceremonial preperation and presentation of matcha tea, with its roots in Zen Buddhisim. A must for visiting Japan!

column1: Onsen (hot spring) with monkeys at Jigokudani Monkey Park
column2: Only in Japan can you bathe in hot springs – with the local monkeys!

column1: See the Kawasaki city factory in Kanagawa
column2: See the sci fi sight of Kawasaki industrial zone at night (and take lots of pictures)
Rent some very jazzy traditional garb of Japan (the yukata) and go on a date around town! We promise to send you pictures.
Watch some Japanese comedy theatre in Kyoto
This ancient Samurai walking route stretches along a historical road from Tokyo to Kyoto. Help us out with equipment, supplies, snacks and places to stop.

column1: Visit the cup noodle museum in Osaka
column2: This museum showcases the mind-boggling number of instant ramen flavour variations. Pure Japanese kitsch.
Mountainous Karuizawa is one of Japan's most beautiful regions - and ofcourse, the home of Terrace House - Opening New Doors. We'd love to see it! This will cover travel costs and a tour.
